text: Okay I'm torn trying to get a job... Should I focus my free time on making another viral Joke repository, or finish working on world class solution to a problem people with money didn't even know they have(for a paper)? Or cleaning up old repo's of really rushed code from years go?

text: I don’t have a lot of experience looking for a job but I would recommend demonstrating your skills in areas and communities where people are likely looking for your kind of skills. So conferences, blog posts, social media channels, etc. Summarise the problems you see in your domain, the opportunities and what you plan to do to address them. If the problem is of commercial value, and you prove that you can provide a free solution that competes with the best commercial ones, companies will likely take notice of you before their product becomes completely useless next to yours. That’s one way to do it. You can also just do the good old applying for jobs but I am assuming you tried that already.
